data.details:
October 30, 2014
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM
There are 19 spots available (Registration Closes at 11:59 PM ET on October 26, 2014)
St. Joseph Catholic Church
Jacksonville, FL

Session 2 (In-Town) - October 30 at St Joseph Catholic Church, Cody Enrichment Center, 4152 Loretto Rd

Session 3 (At camp) - November 14-15 at North Fork Leadership Center

Click here to register. Registering for this session registers you for all three sessions

Girl Scouts of Gateway Council Basic Troop Camp Certification allows you to take your girls camping practically anywhere! Anyone in the troop/group can be the camp-trained volunteer. When you sign up for Session II and III, you must be able to attend both of these sessions together, as the in-town is the planning session for the camp session.

In order to be certified for this course, participants must complete all three of the stages:

  • Basic Troop Camp Certification Session I (Online): The online portion will review:  Planning with your girls, Kaper Charts, Progression, Outdoor Skills, and more!
  • Basic Troop Camp Certification Session II (In-town): This class will be an opportunity to get together a team and work with other volunteers and plan your meals for the camp session.  This is the in-town session that prepares you for Session III.
  • Basic Troop Camp Certification Session III (Overnight):  Utilize the planning that you and your patrol developed during your in-town training session at camp.  In the final step of this process, volunteers attend camp to participate and demonstrate the skills that they have learned under the careful instruction of a facilitator.   This session has been developed to meet the needs of all of our volunteers.  If you are a hearty camper who has slept in the out-of-doors in a cabin or tent, you will only need to attend this class for the day on Saturday. For those volunteers who have never camped or are uncomfortable with the out-of-doors, you will begin your at-camp session on Friday evening and experience the adventure of sleeping in the out-of-doors.  Discussion with your facilitator during the in-town camp portion will decide which opportunity is best for you.

Last day to register online is October 27, 2014
